title: Python for Everybody
description: Hello and welcome to my site where you learn Python even if you have no programming background.

modules.title: Installing Python
modules.description: The first task is to work through the installation steps including installing Python and text editor.

references.title: Setting up the PythonLearn Environment in Microsoft Windows
Setting up the PythonLearn Environment in Macintosh
Setting up the PythonLearn Environment on a Respberry Pi

json.title: Installing Python
json.description: This assignment is designed to show that you have successfully installed a PHP/MySQL environment.  This assignment is worth 10 points. 4 points come from your peers and 2 points come from you grading other student's submissions and 4 points come from the instructor review of your assignment .
json.grading: This is a relatively simple assignment.  Don't take off points for little mistakes.  If they seem to have done the assignment give them full credit.   Feel free to make suggestions if there are small mistakes.  Please keep your comments positive and useful.  If you do not take grading seriously, the instructors may delete your response and you will lose points.

parts.title: Image (JPG or PNG) of your php.ini display_errors setting (Maximium 1MB per file)
Image (JPG or PNG) of your data as showin in PHPMyAdmin (Maximium 1MB per file)

modules.title: Why Program?
modules.description: We learn why one might want to learn to program, and look at the basic issues with learning to program.

modules.title: Variables, expressions, and statements
modules.description: We learn how to make variables and store data in those variables.

modules.title: Conditional Execution
modules.description: We look at how Python executes some statements and skips others.

videos.title: What Happens When You Click a Link? - Computerphile

modules.title: Functions
modules.description: Take a brief look at how Python implements the 'store and use later' programming pattern.

videos.title: Bonus: Rasmus Lerdorf Interview on Creating PHP

modules.title: Loops and Iterations
modules.description: We look at how Python repeats statements using looping structures.

modules.title: Strings
modules.description: We look at how Python stores and mnipulates textual data using string variables and functions.

modules.title: Files
modules.description: We learn how to open data files on your computer and read throught the files using Python.

modules.title: Lists
modules.description: We look at how HTML forms are created and processed in the PHP language.

modules.title: Dictionaries
modules.description: We look at the object oriented pattern in the PHP language.

modules.title: Tuples
modules.description: We look at how PHP used cookies and manages session data.  We also look at how we properly handle POST requests of form data in web applications.

json.title: Automobiles, Sessions, and POST-Redirect
json.description: In this assignment you will expand a web based application to track data about automobiles and store the data in a MySQL database.  All interactions will follow the POST-Redirect pattern where appropriate.
json.grading: Don't take off points for little mistakes.  If they seem to have done the assignment give them full credit.   Feel free to make suggestions if there are small mistakes.  Please keep your comments positive and useful.  If you do not take grading seriously, the instructors may delete your response and you will lose points.

parts.title: A screen shot (including the URL) of your login.php rejecting an account without an at-sign (@).  You must also include the developer console network tab showing both the POST and GET.
A screen shot of your error log showing correct messages for both a successful and failed login attempt.
This was a duplicate screen shot - please give full credit to any uploaded image - including a kitty picture.

A screen shot (including the URL) of your view.php with three vehicles in the list.  At least one of the vehicles must have '<b>' in its title and it must be shown properly (i.e. the title should not be bold)
A screen shot (including the URL) of your add.php showing the error message for a non-numeric year. You must also include the developer console network tab showing both the POST and GET.
Source code of login.php
Source code of view.php
Source code of add.php

modules.title: Regular Expressions
modules.description: Now we buid our first 'complete' application that has multiple screens to Create, Read, Update and Delete (CRUD) our data.  This brings all the previous concepts together and will form the basis for all later web applications.

json.title: Automobiles CRUD Database
json.description: In this assignment you will expand a web based application to Create, Read, Update, and Delete (C.R.U.D.) data in a MySQL database.  All interactions will follow the POST-Redirect and Flash Message patterns where appropriate.  All generated HTML must be properly protected using htmlentities().
json.grading: Don't take off points for little mistakes.  If they seem to have done the assignment give them full credit.   Feel free to make suggestions if there are small mistakes.  Please keep your comments positive and useful.  If you do not take grading seriously, the instructors may delete your response and you will lose points.

parts.title: A screen shot (including the URL) of your login.php rejecting an incorrect password showing the developer console that proves you did a POST-Redirect
A screen shot (with URL) of your add.php showing ACCESS DENIED
A screen shot (including the URL) of your index.php with three entries in the list
A screen shot (including the URL) of your add.php showing a validation error
A screen shot (including the URL) showing three rows of data in your MySQL administration interface
A screen shot (including the URL) of your edit.php showing the error message for invalid data
A screen shot (including the URL) of your view.php showing a successful delete.

Source code of edit.php

modules.title: Network Programming
modules.description: We talk a quick look at the JavaScript language. We assume that you already know PHP - so it is a pretty quick introduction focusing on what is different about JavaScript.

videos.title: Bonus: Building JavaScript with with Brendan Eich

json.title: Profile Database
json.description: In this assignment you will write a simple resume database that support Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations (CRUD).  You will also move user information into its own table and link entries between two tables using foreign keys.  You will also add some in-browser JavaScript data validation.
json.grading: Don't take off points for little mistakes.  If they seem to have done the assignment give them full credit.   Feel free to make suggestions if there are small mistakes.  Please keep your comments positive and useful.  If you do not take grading seriously, the instructors may delete your response and you will lose points.

parts.title: A screen shot (including the URL) of your index.php with the user logged in three resumes  in the list.
A screen shot (including the URL) of your edit.php showing the error message for a bad email address
A screen shot (including the URL) of your delete.php showing that you are showing the confirmation screen before the delete is being done.
A screen shot of your Profile database table showing three rows

modules.title: Objects
modules.description: We do a quick look at how the JavaScript language supports the Object-Oriented pattern.

modules.title: Web Services
modules.description: This is a brief introduction to the JQuery library which is widely used to do in-browser manipulation of the Document Object Model(DOM) and event handling.

json.title: Profiles, Positions and jQuery
json.description: In this assignment you will add a many-to-one relationship to represent how a Profile will reference multiple positions.  You will use jQuery to build a dynamic User Interface where postition entries are added in the browser.
json.grading: Don't take off points for little mistakes.  If they seem to have done the assignment give them full credit.   Feel free to make suggestions if there are small mistakes.  Please keep your comments positive and useful.  If you do not take grading seriously, the instructors may delete your response and you will lose points.

modules.title: Databases
modules.description: In this section we look at JavaScript Object Notation (JSON).  JSON is commonly used as a syntax to exchange data between code running on the server (i.e. in PHP) and code running in the browser (JavaScript/JQuery.

json.title: Profiles, Positions, and Education
json.description: In this assignment you will extend our simple resume database to support Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations (CRUD) into a Education table that has a many-to-one relationship to our Profile table and a many-to-many relationship to an Institution table. We will add an JQuery autocomplete field to our user interface.
json.grading: Don't take off points for little mistakes.  If they seem to have done the assignment give them full credit.   Feel free to make suggestions if there are small mistakes.  Please keep your comments positive and useful.  If you do not take grading seriously, the instructors may delete your response and you will lose points.

A screen shot (including the URL) of your edit.php showing one education entry modified, one education entry deleted and one new education entry
A screen shot (including the URL) of your view.php showing the correct new education entry after the edit is complete
A screen shot (including the URL) of your add.php showing the error message for a bad year
A screen shot of your Education database table showing at least three rows
A screen shot of your Institution database table showing at least one new row inserted when the institution name did not match an existing instutition

modules.title: Data Visualization
modules.description: In this section we look at moving the templates to build HTML fragments from the server (PHP) in to the browser (JavaScript) using the Handlebars library.
